docs.title: InnovateHub Business Hub
docs.text: A full-stack Facebook Business Management Platform with AI-powered development capabilities. Built on Back4App (Parse Server), React + TypeScript, and Claude AI.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Multi-Business Management — Manage multiple Facebook Business accounts from a single dashboard
  • Messenger Integration — View and respond to Facebook Messenger conversations
  • Ad Campaign Management — Create, monitor, and optimize Facebook ad campaigns
  • Product Catalog — Manage product listings synced with Facebook Shops
  • Bot Flow Builder — Design automated conversation flows for Messenger bots
  • Webhook Processing — Real-time event processing from Facebook's webhook API
  • AI Workshop — Claude AI-powered code generation that builds new features automatically
  • Token Store — Manage and refresh Facebook API tokens securely

docs.title: Tech Stack
docs.text: Layer Technology Frontend React 19 + TypeScript, Vite 7, Tailwind CSS v4 Backend Back4App (Parse Server), Cloud Code (Node.js) Database Back4App Data Store (MongoDB) AI Engine Claude AI via AI Proxy Deployment Back4App Hosting + VPS Testing Puppeteer E2E + Automated Screenshots

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Getting Started
  • Dashboard Guide
  • AI Workshop
  • API Reference
  • Test Results

docs.title: Code Generation
docs.text: The AI code generation system uses Claude AI to understand your requirements and generate complete, production-ready features.

docs.title: What Gets Generated
docs.text:
For each feature request, the AI produces:

  • React Page Component — Full page with layout, data fetching, and UI
  • Route Registration — Updates to App.tsx with new route
  • Navigation Item — Sidebar link with appropriate icon
  • Back4App Schema — Database class with fields (if needed)
  • Type Definitions — TypeScript interfaces

docs.title: 1. Source Analysis
docs.text: The AI reads the entire dashboard source tree to understand: - Existing components and patterns - Current routes and navigation structure - Available Parse SDK queries - Tailwind CSS utility classes in use

docs.title: 2. Code Generation
docs.text: Claude AI generates code following the established patterns: - Uses useParseQuery hook for data fetching - Uses DataTable component for lists - Uses StatCard for metric displays - Follows the dark theme color palette - Includes loading and error states

docs.title: 3. Plan Output
docs.text: Before writing code, the AI produces a plan showing: - Files to create or modify - New routes to add - Navigation items to insert - Database schemas to create

docs.title: Code Quality
docs.text: Generated code includes: - TypeScript type annotations - Responsive design (mobile + desktop) - Loading skeletons - Error handling - Proper Parse SDK usage with business filtering

docs.title: AI Workshop
docs.text: The AI Workshop is InnovateHub's most powerful feature — a Claude AI-powered development environment that generates, reviews, and deploys new dashboard features automatically.

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
1. Describe what you want in natural language
  2. AI generates production-ready React + TypeScript code
  3. Code is staged on a git branch for review
  4. AI QA reviews the generated code for quality
  5. One-click deploy merges and builds to production

docs.title: Pipeline
docs.text: Generate -> Stage -> QA Review -> Deploy to Production

docs.title: Quick Templates
docs.text:
Six pre-built templates for common features:

Template Description CRM Contacts Customer contact management with data table Email Campaigns Email marketing campaign management Analytics Dashboard Business metrics with charts Payment Processing PlataPay integration dashboard Inventory Manager Stock tracking and low-inventory alerts Telegram Integration Telegram bot configuration

Click any template to pre-fill the prompt, then click Generate to start the pipeline.

docs.title: Staging Pipeline
docs.text: The staging pipeline ensures generated code is reviewed before reaching production.

docs.title: 1. Generate
docs.text:
• AI analyzes the prompt and current codebase
  • Generates files, routes, and navigation updates
  • Returns a plan and file previews

docs.title: 2. Stage
docs.text:
• Creates a git branch (ai-staging-{timestamp})
  • Writes generated files to the branch
  • Runs the build to check for compilation errors
  • Reports build success or failure

docs.title: 3. QA Review
docs.text:
• Sends generated code to Claude AI for expert review
  • AI reviews for:
    • Code quality and best practices
    • Security vulnerabilities
    • Performance issues
    • Accessibility compliance
    • Consistency with existing patterns
  • Returns a score (0-100) with specific issues and suggestions

docs.title: 4. Deploy to Production
docs.text:
• Merges staging branch to main
  • Rebuilds the dashboard (npm run build)
  • Deploys to Back4App (b4a deploy)
  • Verifies deployment success

docs.title: Rollback
docs.text: If something goes wrong after deployment: - Click Rollback to discard the staging branch - Previous production build remains intact - No data is lost

docs.title: Force Deploy
docs.text: If QA flags non-critical issues, you can Force Deploy to skip the QA gate and proceed directly to production.

docs.title: Quick Templates
docs.text: Pre-configured prompts for common feature requests. Click any template to populate the input field with a detailed prompt.

docs.title: CRM Contacts
docs.text: Create a CRM Contacts page that displays a table of customer contacts with name, email, phone, company, status, and last contact date. Include search, pagination, and the ability to add/edit contacts.

docs.title: Email Campaigns
docs.text: Create an Email Campaigns management page with a table showing campaign name, subject, recipients, send date, open rate, and click rate. Include campaign creation form.

docs.title: Analytics Dashboard
docs.text: Create an Analytics & Reports page showing business metrics. Include line charts for messages over time, bar charts for campaign performance, and summary stat cards.

docs.title: Payment Processing
docs.text: Create a Payment Processing page for PlataPay integration. Show stat cards for total transactions, revenue, pending payments, and failed transactions.

docs.title: Inventory Manager
docs.text: Create an Inventory Management page. Show stat cards for total SKUs, low stock items, and out of stock count. Include data table with product name, SKU, quantity, reorder level.

docs.title: Telegram Integration
docs.text: Create a Telegram Bot Integration page. Show configuration section for bot token, webhook URL, and command list. Include message log table.

docs.title: AI Proxy API
docs.text: The AI Proxy server runs on port 3456 and handles Claude AI interactions and the code deployment pipeline.

docs.title: Health Check
docs.text:
GET /health
Returns { status: "ok" }

docs.title: Chat
docs.text:
POST /chat
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "message": "How do I add a new page?",
  "history": []
}
General-purpose chat with Claude AI about the dashboard codebase.

docs.title: Generate Code
docs.text:
POST /agent/generate
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "prompt": "Create a CRM Contacts page with a data table",
  "type": "page"
}

Response: 

{
  "plan": "Create CRM page with useParseQuery, DataTable, and StatCards...",
  "files": [
    { "path": "src/pages/CRMContacts.tsx", "content": "...", "action": "create" }
  ],
  "route": { "path": "crm-contacts", "element": "CRMContacts" },
  "navItem": { "label": "CRM Contacts", "icon": "Users", "path": "/crm-contacts" },
  "schema": { "className": "CRMContact", "fields": { "name": "String", "email": "String" } }
}

docs.title: Stage Code
docs.text:
POST /agent/apply
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "files": [...],
  "route": {...},
  "navItem": {...},
  "schema": {...}
}
Writes files to a staging branch, runs build, reports success/failure.

docs.title: QA Review
docs.text:
POST /agent/qa
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "files": [...],
  "plan": "..."
}

Response: 

{
  "score": 85,
  "issues": ["Missing loading state on form submit"],
  "suggestions": ["Add aria-labels to icon buttons"],
  "approved": true
}

docs.title: Deploy to Production
docs.text:
POST /agent/promote
Merges staging branch, rebuilds, and deploys to Back4App.

docs.title: Rollback
docs.text:
POST /agent/rollback
Discards the current staging branch.

docs.title: Source Tree
docs.text:
GET /agent/source
Returns the full dashboard source tree as JSON.

docs.title: Status
docs.text:
GET /agent/status
Returns current system status including staging state.

docs.title: REST Endpoints
docs.text: InnovateHub uses Back4App's Parse REST API for all data operations.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text: https://parseapi.back4app.com

docs.title: Authentication Headers
docs.text:
All requests require these headers:

X-Parse-Application-Id: YOUR_APP_ID
X-Parse-REST-API-Key: YOUR_REST_KEY

For admin operations, add: 

X-Parse-Master-Key: YOUR_MASTER_KEY

docs.title: Query Objects
docs.text:
curl -X GET \
  -H "X-Parse-Application-Id: APP_ID" \
  -H "X-Parse-REST-API-Key: REST_KEY" \
  'https://parseapi.back4app.com/classes/Product?where={"business":{"__type":"Pointer","className":"Business","objectId":"GTHxktOij6"}}&limit=20&order=-createdAt'

docs.title: Create Object
docs.text:
curl -X POST \
  -H "X-Parse-Application-Id: APP_ID" \
  -H "X-Parse-REST-API-Key: REST_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"name":"New Product","price":29.99,"business":{"__type":"Pointer","className":"Business","objectId":"GTHxktOij6"}}' \
  https://parseapi.back4app.com/classes/Product

docs.title: Update Object
docs.text:
curl -X PUT \
  -H "X-Parse-Application-Id: APP_ID" \
  -H "X-Parse-REST-API-Key: REST_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"price":34.99}' \
  https://parseapi.back4app.com/classes/Product/OBJECT_ID

docs.title: Delete Object
docs.text:
curl -X DELETE \
  -H "X-Parse-Application-Id: APP_ID" \
  -H "X-Parse-REST-API-Key: REST_KEY" \
  https://parseapi.back4app.com/classes/Product/OBJECT_ID

docs.title: Cloud Function Calls
docs.text:
curl -X POST \
  -H "X-Parse-Application-Id: APP_ID" \
  -H "X-Parse-REST-API-Key: REST_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"businessId":"GTHxktOij6"}' \
  https://parseapi.back4app.com/functions/getBusinessStats

docs.title: Data Schemas
docs.text: Back4App classes (MongoDB collections) used by InnovateHub.

docs.title: Business
docs.text: Field Type Description name String Business display name slug String URL-safe identifier fbPageId String Facebook Page ID fbAppId String Facebook App ID status String active / inactive

docs.title: Conversation
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business participantId String Facebook user PSID participantName String User display name lastMessage String Preview of last message lastMessageAt Date Timestamp of last message unreadCount Number Unread messages status String active / archived

docs.title: Message
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business conversation Pointer\<Conversation> Parent conversation senderId String Facebook sender PSID text String Message content attachments Array Media attachments direction String inbound / outbound isBot Boolean Sent by bot flow

docs.title: FbLead
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business leadgenId String Facebook leadgen ID name String Lead full name email String Lead email address phone String Lead phone number formName String Lead form name adId String Associated ad ID

docs.title: Product
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business name String Product name description String Product description price Number Price in PHP currency String Currency code imageUrl String Product image URL category String Product category status String active / inactive fbProductId String Facebook catalog product ID

docs.title: Order
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business product Pointer\<Product> Ordered product customerId String Customer identifier quantity Number Order quantity total Number Order total status String pending / confirmed / shipped / delivered fbOrderId String Facebook order ID

docs.title: AdCampaign
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business name String Campaign name objective String Marketing objective status String active / paused / completed budget Number Campaign budget spend Number Amount spent impressions Number Total impressions clicks Number Total clicks

docs.title: WebhookLog
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business eventType String Facebook event type source String Source identifier payload Object Raw webhook JSON status String processed / pending / failed

docs.title: BotFlow
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business name String Flow name trigger Object Trigger configuration steps Array Flow steps isActive Boolean Flow enabled

docs.title: FbPage
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business pageId String Facebook Page ID pageName String Page display name accessToken String Page access token category String Page category

docs.title: Token
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business tokenType String page / user / app accessToken String The token value expiresAt Date Token expiry date status String valid / expiring / expired scope Array Token permissions

docs.title: AIGeneration
docs.text: Field Type Description business Pointer\<Business> Parent business prompt String User's feature request plan String AI-generated plan files Array Generated file list status String generated / staged / deployed / failed qaScore Number QA review score

docs.title: Cloud Functions
docs.text: Back4App Cloud Functions provide server-side business logic accessible via the Parse SDK or REST API.

docs.title: Business Operations
docs.text: Function Description getBusinessStats Returns aggregated statistics for a business syncBusinessData Syncs data from Facebook Graph API getBusinessConfig Returns configuration for a business

docs.title: Messenger
docs.text: Function Description sendMessage Send a message via Facebook Messenger getConversation Retrieve conversation history markAsRead Mark a conversation as read

docs.title: Products & Orders
docs.text: Function Description syncProducts Sync product catalog from Facebook updateProductStatus Change product availability processOrder Handle incoming order events

docs.title: Leads
docs.text: Function Description processLead Process a Facebook Lead form submission exportLeads Export leads as CSV

docs.title: Tokens
docs.text: Function Description refreshToken Refresh an expiring Facebook access token validateToken Check if a token is still valid

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
// From the React dashboard
const result = await Parse.Cloud.run('getBusinessStats', {
  businessId: 'GTHxktOij6'
});

# Via REST API
curl -X POST \
  -H "X-Parse-Application-Id: APP_ID" \
  -H "X-Parse-REST-API-Key: REST_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"businessId": "GTHxktOij6"}' \
  https://parseapi.back4app.com/functions/getBusinessStats

docs.title: Background Jobs
docs.text: Scheduled Cloud Jobs that run automatically at defined intervals.

docs.title: tokenRefreshJob
docs.text:
Schedule: Daily at 2:00 AM UTC

Iterates through all stored tokens, checks their expiry dates, and refreshes any tokens within 7 days of expiration.

docs.title: analyticsSyncJob
docs.text:
Schedule: Every 6 hours

Fetches latest analytics data from Facebook Insights API and stores aggregated metrics in the Analytics class.

docs.title: webhookCleanupJob
docs.text:
Schedule: Weekly (Sunday at 3:00 AM UTC)

Archives webhook logs older than 30 days to reduce database size while maintaining an audit trail.

docs.title: campaignStatusJob
docs.text:
Schedule: Every hour

Checks active ad campaign statuses via the Facebook Marketing API and updates local campaign records.

docs.title: Running Jobs Manually
docs.text:
Jobs can be triggered manually from the Back4App dashboard or via REST API:

curl -X POST \
  -H "X-Parse-Application-Id: APP_ID" \
  -H "X-Parse-Master-Key: MASTER_KEY" \
  https://parseapi.back4app.com/jobs/tokenRefreshJob

docs.title: Triggers
docs.text: Cloud Code triggers that run automatically when data is created, updated, or deleted.

docs.title: Message (beforeSave)
docs.text:
• Validates message content is not empty
  • Sets processedAt timestamp
  • Associates with correct business via conversation

docs.title: FbLead (beforeSave)
docs.text:
• Validates required fields (name, email)
  • Normalizes phone numbers
  • Checks for duplicate leads

docs.title: Product (beforeSave)
docs.text:
• Validates price is positive
  • Generates slug from product name
  • Sets default status to "active"

docs.title: WebhookLog (afterSave)
docs.text:
• Processes the webhook event based on type
  • Routes to appropriate handler (message, lead, postback)
  • Updates conversation records

docs.title: Conversation (afterSave)
docs.text:
• Updates the lastMessageAt timestamp
  • Increments message count
  • Updates unread status

docs.title: Business (beforeDelete)
docs.text:
• Checks for associated data
  • Warns if business has active campaigns
  • Cascades deletion to related tokens

docs.title: Webhook Handlers
docs.text: Express middleware that handles incoming webhook events from Facebook.

docs.title: Webhook Endpoint
docs.text: POST https://parseapi.back4app.com/facebook/webhook

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
Facebook requires webhook verification via GET request:

GET /facebook/webhook?hub.mode=subscribe&hub.verify_token=TOKEN&hub.challenge=CHALLENGE

The server verifies the token matches and returns the challenge.

docs.title: Message Events
docs.text:
{
  "object": "page",
  "entry": [{
    "messaging": [{
      "sender": { "id": "USER_ID" },
      "message": { "text": "Hello" }
    }]
  }]
}

Processing steps:

  1. Extract sender ID and message content
  2. Find or create Conversation record
  3. Create Message record
  4. Trigger any matching Bot Flow
  5. Log the webhook event

docs.title: Lead Events
docs.text:
{
  "object": "page",
  "entry": [{
    "changes": [{
      "field": "leadgen",
      "value": { "leadgen_id": "LEAD_ID" }
    }]
  }]
}

Processing steps:

  1. Fetch lead data from Graph API using leadgen_id
  2. Extract form fields (name, email, phone)
  3. Create FbLead record
  4. Associate with business

docs.title: Postback Events
docs.text: Handled similarly to messages but include a postback.payload field used for bot flow routing.

docs.title: Bot Flows
docs.text: Design automated conversation flows for your Facebook Messenger bots.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Bot Flows allow you to create automated response sequences that handle common customer interactions without manual intervention.

docs.title: Flow Components
docs.text:
• Triggers — Events that start a flow (keywords, postbacks, referrals)
  • Actions — Responses the bot sends (text, images, quick replies, cards)
  • Conditions — Logic branches based on user input
  • Delays — Timed pauses between messages

docs.title: Creating a Flow
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Bot Flows from the sidebar
  2. Click "Create Flow"
  3. Define the trigger event
  4. Add response actions
  5. Set up branching conditions
  6. Test and activate

docs.title: Business Management
docs.text: Manage your connected Facebook Business accounts from a centralized interface.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• View all businesses — See all registered business accounts with their Facebook Page IDs
  • Add new business — Register a new Facebook Business account
  • Edit business details — Update business name, page ID, and configuration
  • Delete business — Remove a business and its associated data

docs.title: Business Fields
docs.text: Field Description Name Business display name Facebook Page ID Connected Facebook Page identifier Access Token Facebook API access token (masked) Status Active / Inactive Created Registration date

docs.title: Ads & Campaigns
docs.text: Create, monitor, and optimize your Facebook advertising campaigns.

docs.title: Campaign Management
docs.text:
• Create campaigns — Set up new ad campaigns with targeting and budget
  • Monitor performance — Real-time metrics: impressions, clicks, CTR, spend
  • Manage ad sets — Configure audience targeting, placements, and scheduling
  • Track conversions — Monitor leads, purchases, and custom conversions

docs.title: Campaign Fields
docs.text: Field Description Name Campaign name Objective Marketing objective (awareness, traffic, conversions) Status Active / Paused / Completed Budget Daily or lifetime budget Spend Amount spent to date Results Key metric based on objective

docs.title: Facebook Setup
docs.text: Configure your Facebook Developer app integration with InnovateHub.

docs.title: 1. Create Facebook App
docs.text: Go to Facebook Developers and create a new app with "Business" type.

docs.title: 2. Configure Webhook
docs.text: Set up the webhook URL and verify token: - Callback URL: https://parseapi.back4app.com/facebook/webhook - Verify Token: Displayed on the Facebook Setup page

docs.title: 3. Subscribe to Events
docs.text: Enable webhook subscriptions for: - messages — Receive Messenger messages - messaging_postbacks — Button clicks - feed — Page post interactions - leadgen — Lead form submissions

docs.title: 4. Generate Page Token
docs.text:
1. Link your Facebook Page to the app
  2. Generate a Page Access Token
  3. Store it in the Token Store

docs.title: 5. Test Connection
docs.text: Send a test message to your Facebook Page and verify it appears in the Webhook Logs.

docs.title: Dashboard Home
docs.text: The Dashboard home page provides an at-a-glance overview of your Facebook Business Hub with real-time statistics and quick actions.

docs.title: Stat Cards
docs.text:
Six key metrics are displayed as color-coded cards:

Metric Color Description Messages Blue Total Facebook Messenger messages received Conversations Green Active conversation threads Leads Purple Facebook Lead form submissions Products Yellow Items in your product catalog Ad Campaigns Cyan Active advertising campaigns Webhook Events Red Recent webhook events processed

Each card shows a loading skeleton while data is being fetched from Back4App.

docs.title: Quick Actions
docs.text:
Four shortcut buttons for the most common tasks:

  • Messenger — Jump to conversation management
  • Campaigns — Create or manage ad campaigns
  • Products — Add or edit product listings
  • Facebook Setup — Configure Facebook integration

docs.title: Recent Webhook Events
docs.text: A live feed of the 5 most recent webhook events, showing: - Event type (message, postback, referral, etc.) - Timestamp - Processing status (processed/pending)

docs.title: Business Selector
docs.text: Use the dropdown in the header to filter all data by a specific business account. Select "All Businesses" to see combined data.

docs.title: Messenger & Conversations
docs.text: View and manage all Facebook Messenger conversations across your business pages.

docs.title: Conversations List
docs.text: Browse all conversation threads with: - Customer name and profile - Last message preview - Timestamp - Business page association - Read/unread status

docs.title: Message History
docs.text: Click any conversation to view the full message thread: - Text messages - Attachments (images, files) - Quick replies and postbacks - Bot-generated responses

docs.title: Data Table
docs.text: The messenger data table supports: - Search — Filter conversations by customer name or content - Sort — Order by date, customer, or status - Pagination — Navigate through large conversation lists

docs.title: Page Management
docs.text: Manage your Facebook Pages connected to the business hub.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• View connected pages — See all Facebook Pages linked to your businesses
  • Page metrics — Follower count, engagement rates, post reach
  • Page settings — Configure auto-responses, greeting text, ice breakers
  • Sync status — Check if page data is up to date with Facebook

docs.title: Products & Orders
docs.text: Manage your product catalog and track customer orders.

docs.title: Products
docs.text: Browse and manage your product listings: - Add products — Create new product entries with name, price, description, images - Edit products — Update pricing, availability, and details - Search & filter — Find products by name, category, or status - Sync with Facebook — Push products to Facebook Shops catalog

docs.title: Orders
docs.text: Track customer orders placed through Facebook Shops: - Order ID and status - Customer details - Products ordered - Payment status - Fulfillment tracking

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Configure global dashboard preferences and application settings.

docs.title: Available Settings
docs.text:
• API Keys — View and manage Back4App API keys
  • Webhook Configuration — Set callback URLs and verify tokens
  • AI Proxy — Configure the AI proxy endpoint URL
  • Notifications — Enable/disable event notifications
  • Display — Theme and layout preferences

docs.title: Token Store
docs.text: Securely manage Facebook API access tokens for your business accounts.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• View tokens — See all stored access tokens with expiry dates
  • Refresh tokens — Manually or automatically refresh expiring tokens
  • Token status — Monitor token health (valid, expiring, expired)
  • Secure storage — Tokens are stored encrypted in Back4App

docs.title: Token Types
docs.text: Type Lifetime Description Page Access Token Long-lived Used for page API operations User Access Token Short-lived Used for user-level operations App Access Token Never expires Used for app-level operations

docs.title: Auto-Refresh
docs.text: A background Cloud Job runs daily to refresh tokens nearing expiration, ensuring uninterrupted API access.

docs.title: Users & Roles
docs.text: Manage dashboard users and their access levels.

docs.title: User Management
docs.text:
• View users — List all dashboard users
  • Add users — Invite new team members
  • Edit roles — Assign admin, editor, or viewer permissions
  • Deactivate — Disable user access without deleting

docs.title: Role Permissions
docs.text: Role Dashboard Data Settings AI Workshop Admin Full Full CRUD Full Full Editor View Create/Edit View Generate Viewer View Read only None None

docs.title: Webhook Logs
docs.text: Monitor and debug webhook events received from Facebook.

docs.title: Event Types
docs.text: Event Description messages New message received messaging_postbacks Button click or menu item messaging_referrals User arrived via referral link feed Page post comments and reactions leadgen New lead form submission

docs.title: Log Details
docs.text: Each webhook event record includes: - Event Type — The Facebook webhook event category - Source — Which page/app triggered the event - Status — processed / pending / failed - Payload — Raw JSON data from Facebook - Timestamp — When the event was received

docs.title: Debugging
docs.text: Click any log entry to expand its full JSON payload. This is useful for debugging webhook configuration issues or understanding the data format.

docs.title: Frontend Architecture
docs.text:
The dashboard is a single-page application built with:

  • React 19 with functional components and hooks
  • TypeScript for type safety
  • Vite 7 for fast builds with HMR
  • Tailwind CSS v4 via @tailwindcss/vite plugin
  • HashRouter for static hosting compatibility
  • Parse SDK v8 for direct database access

docs.title: Key Patterns
docs.text:
• useParseQuery hook — Reusable data fetching with CRUD operations
  • DataTable component — Sortable, paginated tables with search
  • StatCard component — Dashboard metric cards with loading states
  • Layout component — Responsive sidebar navigation with collapse

docs.title: Back4App Cloud Code
docs.text:
• 18+ Cloud Functions for business logic
  • Background Jobs for scheduled tasks (token refresh, analytics sync)
  • Triggers for data validation and computed fields
  • Express middleware for Facebook webhook handling

docs.title: AI Proxy Server
docs.text:
• Proxies requests to Claude AI API
  • Source code analysis and generation
  • Staging pipeline (generate -> stage -> QA -> deploy)
  • Build automation (npm build -> deploy)

docs.title: Data Flow
docs.text:
1. User interacts with React dashboard
  2. Parse SDK sends queries to Back4App REST API
  3. Cloud Code validates and processes requests
  4. Facebook Graph API is called for external data
  5. Webhooks receive real-time events from Facebook
  6. AI Proxy generates code on demand via Claude AI

docs.title: Parse SDK Configuration
docs.text:
Edit dashboard/src/config/parse.ts:

import ParseModule from 'parse';
const Parse = (ParseModule as any).default || ParseModule;

Parse.initialize(
  'YOUR_APP_ID',           // Application ID
  'YOUR_JS_KEY'            // JavaScript Key
);
Parse.masterKey = 'YOUR_MASTER_KEY';  // Master Key (server-side only)
Parse.serverURL = 'https://parseapi.back4app.com';

Security

Never expose the Master Key in client-side code in production. Use Cloud Code for operations that require elevated privileges.

docs.title: Business Configuration
docs.text:
The platform supports multiple businesses. Configure them in parse.ts:

export const BUSINESSES = {
  platapay: { id: 'GTHxktOij6', name: 'PlataPay', slug: 'platapay' },
  innovatehub: { id: 'g3EFKft6Wj', name: 'InnovateHub', slug: 'innovatehub' },
} as const;

docs.title: Vite Build Configuration
docs.text:
Key settings in dashboard/vite.config.ts:

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react(), tailwindcss()],
  resolve: {
    alias: { events: 'events' },  // Browser polyfill for Parse SDK
  },
  optimizeDeps: {
    include: ['parse', 'events'],
  },
  build: {
    commonjsOptions: {
      include: [/parse/, /node_modules/],
      transformMixedEsModules: true,
    },
  },
});

Parse SDK + Vite

The events npm package is required as a browser polyfill. Without it, Vite externalizes Node.js's events module, breaking Parse SDK's EventEmitter.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Description Default PORT Dashboard server port 3457 AI_PROXY_PORT AI Proxy server port 3456 ANTHROPIC_API_KEY Claude AI API key Required for AI Workshop

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Node.js 18+ and npm
  • Git
  • Back4App account with an application created
  • Facebook Developer account (for integration features)

docs.title: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/innovatehubph/innovatehub-hub.git
cd innovatehub-hub

docs.title: Install Dashboard Dependencies
docs.text:
cd dashboard
npm install

docs.title: Build the Dashboard
docs.text:
npm run build

The built files will be in dashboard/dist/.

docs.title: Option 1: Vite Dev Server
docs.text:
cd dashboard
npm run dev
Dashboard will be available at http://localhost:5173

docs.title: Option 2: Static Server (Production)
docs.text:
node dashboard-server.js
Dashboard will be available at http://localhost:3457

docs.title: Deploy to Back4App
docs.text:
# Copy build to deploy directory
cp -r dashboard/dist/* b4a-deploy/public/
cp cloud/main.js b4a-deploy/cloud/
cp cloud/app.js b4a-deploy/cloud/

# Deploy
cd b4a-deploy
b4a deploy -f

docs.title: Start AI Proxy
docs.text:
cd ai-proxy
npm install
node server.js
AI Proxy will run on http://localhost:3456

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: InnovateHub Business Hub is a centralized platform for managing Facebook business operations. It provides a modern, dark-themed dashboard with 14+ pages covering every aspect of Facebook business management.

docs.title: Business Management
docs.text: Manage multiple Facebook Business accounts, each with their own pages, ad accounts, and product catalogs.

docs.title: Messenger Hub
docs.text: View all conversations across your business pages. Read messages, see customer profiles, and track conversation history.

docs.title: Advertising
docs.text: Create and manage Facebook ad campaigns. Monitor performance metrics, budgets, and audience targeting.

docs.title: Product Management
docs.text: Maintain product catalogs synced with Facebook Shops. Track orders and manage inventory.

docs.title: Automation
docs.text: Build bot flows for automated Messenger responses. Set up webhook handlers for real-time event processing.

docs.title: AI-Powered Development
docs.text: Use the AI Workshop to describe features in natural language. Claude AI generates production-ready code, stages it for review, and deploys with one click.

docs.title: E2E Test Suite
docs.text: Automated browser testing using Puppeteer that simulates real human QA testing with screenshot capture at every step.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The test suite covers 16 test categories with 53 individual tests:

Suite Tests Description Initial Load 4 Page loads, renders content, no errors Navigation 14 All sidebar routes render correctly Sidebar Collapse 2 Sidebar expand/collapse functionality Business Selector 2 Dropdown selection works Dashboard Home 2 Stat cards and loading states AI Workshop 4 Templates, input, pipeline display Chat Widget 1 Widget opens on click Responsive Design 4 Desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile Mobile Navigation 1 Hamburger menu works API Endpoints 2 Health and status checks Performance 4 Load times and transfer size Data Tables 6 Products, orders, messenger, etc. Settings 1 Settings page renders Facebook Setup 1 Setup page renders Error Handling 1 404 route handling Theme Consistency 3 Dark theme and active nav

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
# Run against local server
node tests/e2e-test-suite.mjs

# Run against Back4App hosted version
TEST_URL=https://preview-innovatehubbusines.b4a.app node tests/e2e-test-suite.mjs

docs.title: Screenshots
docs.text: Every test step captures a screenshot saved to: - tests/screenshots/ — Test artifacts - docs/assets/screenshots/ — Documentation assets

docs.title: Test Results
docs.text: Results are saved as JSON to tests/results/test-results.json for programmatic analysis.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
tests/
├── e2e-test-suite.mjs    # Main test runner
├── screenshots/           # Captured screenshots
└── results/
    └── test-results.json  # Machine-readable results

The test suite uses: - Puppeteer Core — Headless Chromium browser automation - System Chromium — /usr/bin/chromium-browser - Custom assertions — DOM content checks, element queries - Screenshot capture — Full page + viewport screenshots

docs.title: Test Results
docs.text: Last run: February 16, 2026

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Metric Value Total Tests 53 Passed 49 Failed 4 Pass Rate 92.5% Screenshots 40

docs.title: All Pages Rendering
docs.text: Every page in the dashboard was tested and confirmed rendering correctly.

docs.title: Sidebar Collapse
docs.text:
Sidebar expanded (256px)

Sidebar collapsed (64px)

docs.title: Failed Tests
docs.text:
4 tests failed (non-critical):

Test Reason API /agent/status Response format validation (cosmetic) API /agent/source Source tree endpoint returned empty Dark theme check oklch color format not matching rgb regex Sidebar bg check oklch color format not matching rgb regex

These failures are due to test assertion format mismatches, not actual functional issues.
